intro: Tetranthera brawas, commonly known as the Brawas tetranthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Tetranthera brawas is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
